com.fasterxml.storemate.store

Class StorePartitions

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.fasterxml.storemate.store.StorePartitions

  • public class StorePartitions
extends Object
    Helper class for partitioning keyspace into single-access 'slices'

    • Constructor Detail

      • StorePartitions

        public StorePartitions(StoreBackend store,
               int n,
               boolean fair)
        Parameters:
        n - Minimum number of partitions (rounded up to next power of 2)
        fair - Whether underlying semaphores should be fair or not; fair ones have more overhead, but mostly (only?) for contested access, not uncontested

    • Method Detail

      • withLockedPartition

        public <IN,OUT> OUT withLockedPartition(StorableKey key,
                               long startTime,
                               StoreOperationCallback<IN,OUT> cb,
                               IN arg)
                        throws IOException,
                               StoreException
        Method to call to perform arbitrary multi-part atomic operations, guarded by partitioned lock. Note that since this method is essentially synchronized on N-way partitioned mutex, it is essential that execution time is minimized to the critical section.
        Parameters:
        key - Entry being operated on
        startTime - Timestamp operation may use as "last-modified" timestamp; must not be greater than the current system time (virtual or real)
        cb - Callback to call from locked context
        arg - Optional argument
        Throws:
        IOException
        StoreException

      • getOldestInFlightTimestamp

        public long getOldestInFlightTimestamp()
        Method that can be called to find if there are operations in-flight, and if so, get the oldest timestamp from those operations. This can be used to calculate high-water marks for traversing last-modified index (to avoid accessing things modified after start of traversal). Note that this only establishes conservative lower bound: due to race condition, the oldest operation may finish before this method returns.
        Returns:
        Timestamp of the "oldest" operation still being performed, if any, or 0L if none

      • getInFlightCount

        public int getInFlightCount()
        Method that will count number of operations in-flight currently.
